header_subtitle: Ph.D. Student · National University of Singapore
hero_lead: I work on multimodal language models and multimedia retrieval, with a recent focus on bridging symbolic and waveform music representations.
about_html: Hi! I am Teng Tu (涂腾), a Ph.D. student at the National University of Singapore. My research spans multimodal language models and multimedia information retrieval, with ongoing work on music-language modeling that unifies symbolic and waveform representations.
focus: Learning representations that align dynamics across modalities (text / audio / music / video)
Structured music modeling across multiple granularities

research_cards.title: Music-Language Modeling
research_cards.desc: Unifying symbolic + waveform music for knowledge, understanding and generation.

research_cards.title: Multimodal Retrieval
research_cards.desc: Multimodal representations and retrieval for downstream reasoning and QA.

research_cards.title: Knowledge + Reasoning
research_cards.desc: Knowledge graphs and multi-hop reasoning; benchmark construction.
